metadata.synopsis: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.

14.speaker: Gribbo
14.context: NodeContext: Gribbo doesn't know player's name, so she's saying 'Yourself' as though that's the player's name.

20.speaker: Gribbo
20.context: NodeContext: Pidge is pronounced as the first syllable of pigeon. thoughtful

21.speaker: Gribbo
21.text: Don't go botherin' my pigeon! He's mine.
21.context: NodeContext: annoyed, defensive - the 'pigeon' is in fact Volo, a human captive she's been forcing to sing; he's now locked behind a prison door

54.speaker: Player
54.text: So I see. Do you have plans for this 'pigeon'?

32.speaker: Gribbo
32.text: Keep him safe. Listen to him coo. 'Til I gets hungry or some such.
32.context: NodeContext: explaining as if to an idiot

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Your pet is actually a rather famous writer.

4.speaker: Gribbo
4.context: NodeContext: dismissing a stupid idea presented to her

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I was admiring him. I'd like one of my own.

57.speaker: Gribbo
57.text: Then catch one on your own.
57.context: NodeContext: heavy emphasis on 'catch' - she's telling us to catch our own pet rather than taking hers

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Withholding prisoners? Your boss won't be happy to hear that.

38.speaker: Gribbo
38.text: What?! I... I ain't. Minthara don't give a cake what you think.

61.speaker: Gribbo
61.text: Bah. Just take him, if you care so much. See if he'll sing for the likes of you though. Bloody fink.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I've taken a shine to this one. How much do you want for him?

29.speaker: Gribbo
29.text: More'n you've got, mate. I likes him.

3.speaker: Gribbo
3.text: But, erm, how much do ya got?

60.speaker: Gribbo
60.text: Eh! I could buy a bagoolion pigeons with that much!

26.speaker: Gribbo
26.text: Please. You ain't got that much. Look at that state of you.

27.speaker: Gribbo
27.text: Eh! I could buy twelve pigeons with that much!

55.speaker: Gribbo
55.text: Please. You ain't got that much. Look at that state of you.

76.speaker: Gribbo
76.text: Pigeon's worth more'n that times a bagoolion.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Offer as little as you can spare. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

85.speaker: Gribbo
85.text: You funnin'? Pigeon don't take a kra-kra for that much.
85.context: NodeContext: irritated and amused: 'kra-kra' pronounced 'craw-craw'. Means poop.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Offer a bulging bag of fake gold.

77.speaker: Gribbo
77.text: Eh! I could buy a bagoolion pigeons with that much!

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Actually, I have no coin to spare.

72.speaker: Gribbo
72.text: See? You couldn't take care of him proper anyway.

93.speaker: Gribbo
93.text: Y-yes, of course - I didn't realise who you was.

94.speaker: Narrator
94.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

92.speaker: Gribbo
92.text: Here's the key. Pigeon's all yours.
92.context: InternalNodeContext: Gribbo should hand player the key to Volo's cageNodeContext: matter of fact

52.speaker: Gribbo
52.text: Huh?! It were right in my pocket... someone musta nicked it! Bloody maggots.
52.context: NodeContext: shocked to have been pickpocketed

23.speaker: Gribbo
23.text: Here's the key. Pigeon's all yours.
23.context: InternalNodeContext: Gribbo should hand player the key to Volo's cageNodeContext: matter of fact

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

31.speaker: Player
31.text: He looks weak. Sick, even. He won't last long in there.

80.speaker: Gribbo
80.text: Take him for a jog, why don't ya. And don't let the lads snatch him up. No tellin' what they'll do to him.

0.speaker: Gribbo
0.text: Bring him back when he's all tuckered out.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I'm done talking. Open the cage or you'll be sorry.

25.speaker: Gribbo
25.text: All right, all right, calm down. I don't wants no trouble.

39.speaker: Gribbo
39.context: NodeContext: hard g on ranga (RAN-GAH) - obstinately deflecting a threat

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Watch your tongue, or I'll take it.

75.speaker: Gribbo
75.text: This ranga better not go yappin' 'bout my pigeon. I shoulda turned him over to Minthara by now, but he's such a nice little pigeon.
75.context: NodeContext: internal monologue as we read her mind - 'ranga' with a hard g (RAN-GAH). defensive

15.speaker: Gribbo
15.context: NodeContext: She'll go hostile now, reacting to player trying to read her mind (and failing).

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I hate to see such a lovely creature in a cage.

68.speaker: Gribbo
68.text: Ehh, he don't mind. Keeps him safe from me mates! Raids make 'em rabid.
68.context: NodeContext: reassuring herself as much as us

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Does your bird have a name?

91.speaker: Gribbo
91.context: NodeContext: thinking on the spot - 'Pidge' is the name she's just come up with for her captive (pronounced as the first syllable of 'pigeon')

22.speaker: Gribbo
22.context: NodeContext: The guard interrupts my convo with Volo; I shouldn't be disturbing him! He's being sarcastic about Volo being the talent, but not about you not bothering him.
